node.title: Alleged murder victim's injuries were some of the worst paramedics had seen, court hears
node.description: AnÂ alleged domestic violence murder victim's head injuries were "nothing like" emergency services had ever seen before, a court hears.
node.content:
["A court has heard an alleged domestic violence murder victim's head injuries were some of the worst emergency services had ever seen.", "WARNING: This story contains content that some people may find distressing.", "Cherry Gerente Ogar, 37, died of massive head injuries sustained at her Port Hughes home in July 2021.", "Her husband, 58-year-old Antony Ogar, is charged with murdering her.", "In arguing against Mr Ogar being granted home detention bail, prosecutor Kirby Draper told the Adelaide Magistrates' Court paramedics attending Ms Gerente Ogar had described her injuries as like \"nothing like they've seen\".", "Ms Draper said one nurse described Ms Gerente Ogar's injuries as similar only to \"when a patient placed their head in the pathway of a passing train\".", "The prosecution said Mr Ogar had said his wife was drunk and aggressive on the night she was injured, and he pushed her in self-defence, when she hit her head.", "Ms Draper said the defendant contended he had left his wife \"barely conscious\" and crying through the night, before noticing a lump on the right side of her head in the morning.", "At this point Mr Ogar said he realised his wife was unconscious and called the ambulance around 10:30am, the court heard.", "However, Ms Draper said first responders had noted \"it was simply a mattress and soft carpet and no furniture of the like that she could have obviously hit her head on\" at the couple's home.", "She said there were also multiple accounts of those who knew the couple noticing abusing behaviour from Mr Ogar to his wife.", "\"There are statements from friends and family which have seen both physical and verbal abuse of the victim in the past,\" Ms Draper said.", "She said there were also statements from neighbouring properties which could hear \"frequent yelling\" from the house, and former property managers who said they had witnessed Mr Ogar being abusive toward the victim and verbally abusive toward themselves.", "
Home detention bail plea
", "Arguing for Mr Ogar to be granted home detention bail, defence lawyer Anthony Allen QC said there had not yet been results from forensics taken from the incident and repeated the defendant had acted in self-defence.", "He was \"attacked by the deceased who was grossly affected by alcohol\", Mr Allen said.", "Mr Allen argued given Mr Ogar had \"no prior convictions\" he should be allowed to serve home detention bail.", "", "
The Port Hughes home of Cherry Gerente Ogar and Antony Ogar.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "He said Mr Ogar had a $20,000 cash surety as well as a house ready to \"start afresh by himself away from the community\" where the incident happened.", "Mr Ogar will appear in court again next week."]
